Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Whapper \Whap"per\, Whopper \Whop"per\, n. [See {Whap}.] Something uncommonly large of the kind; something astonishing; -- applied especially to a bold lie. Now (1998) usually spelled {whopper}. [Colloq.] [1913 Webster +PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Whapper \Whap"per\, Whopper \Whop"per\, n. [See {Whap}.] Something uncommonly large of the kind; something astonishing; -- applied especially to a bold lie. Now (1998) usually spelled {whopper}. [Colloq.] [1913 Webster +PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Whopper \Whop"per\, n. [Cf. {Whapper}.] 1. One who, or that which, whops. [1913 Webster]
2. something very large, especially a big lie. Same as {Whapper}, but the more common spelling. [1913 Webster]
whopper n 1: a gross untruth; a blatant lie [syn: {walloper}] 2: something especially big or impressive of its kind [syn: {whacker}]
